With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly

subject: Add role tripleo_stream_enable.
commit_message:
Add role tripleo_stream_enable.

This generic role allows us setting a specific stream passed in the
parameter tripleo_stream_enable, being a list of two values, the module
we want to change and the stream to set.

If the module isn't present in the system, the role will fail. Otherwise
it will first check the current stream configured. If the stream configured
matches the one from tripleo_stream_enable.stream nothing else will
be done, if not it will disable the current stream and enable the new
one. Once all the entries from tripleo_stream_enable are processed, a
distro-sync opereation is run to synchronize the content to the newly
configured streams, only if some of the streams were changed.

Related-Bug: #1890631
Resolves: rhbz#1866479

present and can often cause failures during live migrations with
attached volumes. This change ensures the name is unique by running
iscsi-iname again and overwriting the existing name.

given that devstack systems are not supposed to be multi-purpose this
should be safe to do during the devstack run.

commit_message:

cloud-init will use fall-back config when network metadata
is *not* present. This works fine if the first NIC on the node is
connected to a network with DHCP. But, when the first NIC is not
used for provisioning, cloud-init will only write a fallback config
for the first NIC. This causes the provisioned node to be unavailable.

Extend instance configuration to include network metadata so that
cloud-init can configure node networking.

`app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm` label. Thus when kubernetes
sees a Job's labels they are no longer empty and thus do not get
defaulted to the underlying Pod template's labels. This is a
problem since Job labels are depended on by
- Armada pre-upgrade delete hooks
- Armada wait logic configurations
- kubernetes-entrypoint dependencies

Thus for each Job template this adds labels matching the
underlying Pod template to retain the same labels that were
present with Helm 2.

subject: [iRMC] Avoid repeatedly resuming clean after creating raid configuration
commit_message:
[iRMC] Avoid repeatedly resuming clean after creating raid configuration

Fixed the bug of repeated resume cleaning due to the value of `fgi_status` not being updated correctly when obtaining the
RAID configuration status of the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type.

```
Unexpected error when processing next clean step. TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
```

This `NoneType` error occurs because ironic resumes clean without waiting for IPA to get the clean steps, and then it tries to read the
clean steps which should be a list but actually is none.
During auto clean, resume clean should be triggered by IPA, but in this case, it is triggered by a iRMC periodic task which checks
the progress of running raid config.
This error does not occur every time, sometime raid can be configured, auto clean can complete without error and the node can be deployed successfully.

RAID configuration status of the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type.

```
Unexpected error when processing next clean step. TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
```

This `NoneType` error occurs because ironic resumes clean without waiting for IPA to get the clean steps, and then it tries to read the

During auto clean, resume clean should be triggered by IPA, but in this case, it is triggered by a iRMC periodic task which checks

This error does not occur every time, sometime raid can be configured, auto clean can complete without error and the node can be deployed successfully.

subject: Implement a tool for converting policy.yaml files to heat templates
commit_message:
Implement a tool for converting policy.yaml files to heat templates

This commit adds a tool that parses a directory of service.yaml policy
files and then converts them to the appropriate THT structure, using the
necessary service variables and templating.

The enable-secure-rbac.yaml is simply the current defaults generated
from code. First, generate all the policy files for each OpenStack
service:

  $ oslopolicy-sample-generator --namespace $SERVICE --output-file $DEST/$SERVICE.yaml

Next, uncomment all the default policies as a starting point for making
policy changes:

  $ sed -i 's/^#"/"/g' $DEST/$SERVICE.yaml

Next you can make changes to the policy files to reflect the changes you
want in your deployment.

Finally, you can generate the necessary heat template:

  $ ./convert_policy_yaml_to_heat_template.py -d $DEST

The tool outputs to stdout. It's up to the user to redirect to a file if
they wish to save results.

The enable-secure-rbac.yaml environment will be updated in subsequent
patches to implement project personas.

subject: WIP: Add a test for detach/attach root volume
commit_message:
WIP: Add a test for detach/attach root volume

This adds a compute API test for testing the detach and attach of root
volume for instance in shelved_offloaded state.

The Nova change allows to detach the root volume from a shelved offloaded
instance, the tempest test is testing the following path:
- boot an instance from volume
- shelve the instance
- verify that the detach of the root volume works
- verify that the unshelve of the instance fails as the instance doesn't
  have a root volume
- attach the root volume
- verify that the unshelve of the instance works correctly.

Since the os-volume_attachments API response schema changed in 2.72 the
2.72 response schema changes are added:

- attach volume response includes boot_index
- show volume attachment response includes boot_index and volumeId
  can be null if the root volume is detached
- list volume attachments response includes boot_index and volumeId
  can be null if the root volume is detached

The 2.71 servers schema is also back-filled for the same related
volume attachment API schema changes to be used in 2.72.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/623981/

subject: [stable-only] Set lower-constraints job as non-voting
commit_message:
[stable-only] Set lower-constraints job as non-voting

This patch sets the failing lower-constraints job to non-voting until
final fix arrives for the failure.

With the latest setuptools (bundled into python virtualenv) the lower
constraints job started to fail on ussuri when it tries to install old
version of 'decorator'. The error message is:

  error in decorator setup command: use_2to3 is invalid.

The needed minimal version of 'decorator' would be 4.0.0, but it is
only needed if the latest version of setuptools (virtualenv) is used.
On old branches it would be good to pin setuptools (virtualenv),
otherwise we can face similar issues. Until the final decision / fix,
let's just set the lower-constraints job non-voting to unblock the
gate.

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are because of job template name
difference (openstack-python3-ussuri-jobs vs
openstack-python3-train-jobs) and because the following changes are
not in Train:
